publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

seg.seg: Sei [guter] Hoffnung! Du besitzest [wtl. dir sind] gute Taten [d.h. gutes Karman]. Bestimmt werden sie dich [davor] bewahren, (in der) Hölle, (bei den) Tier(en oder den Pretas [wieder]geboren zu werden).
Be in [good] hope! Yours are good deeds [i.e. good karma]. Certainly they will save you from (being [re]born in) hell, (among the) animal(s or the pretas).
Warum bist du so bedrückt? Warum bist du verwirrt?
Why are you so depressed? Why are you confused?

p.note: According to 147 the two parts (63 and 59) are ca. 10.2cm wide; "[t]he united fragment is the left edge of a six line manuscript, which is clearly preserved, except for the corners which are abraded."
aklyy: second y is like the main akṣara and not the ligature variant.

list.item: a3. aklyy: second y is like the main akṣara and not the ligature variant.

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a1 Sei [guter] Hoffnung! Du besitzest [wtl. dir sind] gute Taten [d.h. gutes Karman]. Bestimmt werden sie dich [davor] bewahren, (in der) Hölle, (bei den) Tier(en oder den Pretas [wieder]geboren zu werden). 403
b4 Warum bist du so bedrückt? Warum bist du verwirrt? 156, 159


[[Broomhead I]] has notes on p. 151 and translates on pp. 150-151:

a1 ... rejoiced without worry. Have hope! You have good deeds. Certainly they [= the good deeds] will protect you from hell.

a2 Through the throwing of a flower. Forthwith they are born [again] without number among the gods. I will give you the monk's gifts ...

a3 previously. 37. As he learnt the dharma through faith, so he also learnt for others ...

a4 ... the spiritual power. Cherish the wish to come together with [the] Maitreya!

a5 ... fetters. If you should fall again ...

b2 ... are to be produced. The shadow ...

b3 The faith in cause and effect. The hellish ones more than I ...

b4 The suffering oppressed the mind and the body. "Why are you worried? Why are you confused?"

b5 Have faith in the words of the Omniscient One, whose spirit is pure, not irascible [and is also] full of faith.

b6 Buddha spoke: Having looked at the boy Śuka. "If you produce faith, [then] you shall be born [again] in the divine world. 44. So long as [you begin?] ...

According to [[Broomhead I]]: 147 the two parts (63 and 59) are ca. 10.2cm wide; "[t]he united fragment is the left edge of a six line manuscript, which is clearly preserved, except for the corners which are abraded."

Cherish the wish to come together with [the] Maitreya! </p><p>a5 ... fetters. If you should fall again ... </p><p>b2 ... are to be produced. The shadow ... </p><p>b3 The faith in cause and effect. The hellish ones more than I ... </p><p>b4 The suffering oppressed the mind and the body. "Why are you worried? Why are you confused?" </p><p>b5 Have faith in the words of the Omniscient One, whose spirit is pure, not irascible [and is also] full of faith. </p><p>b6 Buddha spoke: Having looked at the boy Śuka. "If you produce faith, [then] you shall be born [again] in the divine world. 44. So long as [you begin?] ... </p></project_comment>
